result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis James Thornton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Louis James Thornton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Louis James Thornton was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - conviction DNA on file
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called: 15CM93, 15CM514, 15CM568, 16CM156, 16CM330, 15TR5604, 15TR5605, Defendant Louis James Thornton in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 16CM330. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 9 months jail, consecutive to all previously-imposed sentences. Huber granted under jail rules. May transfer to Dane County Jail. No objection to EMP. $443 costs. Submit DNA sample.  In 15CM93, Court imposed $443 costs. Submit DNA sample. All remaining cases and counts read in and dismissed. Jail credit to be determined. No credit in 16CM93.
